channel.title: [PI] Using c.getOutStream().createFrame(187);?

item.title: [PI] Using c.getOutStream().createFrame(187);?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Before any packets are processed, print the opcode that is received when you submit the interface. Then we can see which packet is used for the submission and we can work from there.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Using c.getOutStream().createFrame(187);?
item.dc:creator: @yoeril yoeril
item.description:
@yoeril wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:522289”]Packet 187 (Or in your terms frame 187) displays the “Enter Name” interface.
It isn’t connected to anything, however it is used for adding/removing friends.

So you could look at those to see how the friends list works, and grab the method that saves the text.[/quote]

Yeah I was doing that, but I just cant figur it out. Probably because of my lack of knowledge of working with packets.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Using c.getOutStream().createFrame(187);?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Packet 187 (Or in your terms frame 187) displays the “Enter Name” interface.
It isn’t connected to anything, however it is used for adding/removing friends.

So you could look at those to see how the friends list works, and grab the method that saves the text.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Using c.getOutStream().createFrame(187);?
item.dc:creator: @yoeril yoeril
item.description:
@yoeril wrote:

So I when I click a button I make the frame 187 popup, I can enter text in this frame (Same thing when you add a friend).
How would I catch the text I enter into this frame when I hit enter?

Such as;

string text = frameTextToString();

Thanks

Read full topic
